ctx: intros a b Q Hred Hcan Hcomb.
tactic: apply reducestar_eqp_com with (Q:=Q) (a:=a) (b:=b) in Hred; auto.
exceptions.exn: No such bound variable a (possible names are: A, A0, A1, eqA, plusA, invA, minusA, multA, divA, eqA_dec, n, ltM, ltM_dec, Q, p, q, r and s).

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (a b : list (Term A n)) (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)), reducestar A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q a b -> canonical A0 eqA ltM a -> CombLinear Q a -> CombLinear Q b

Premises:
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
Record Q : Set := Qmake { Qnum : BinNums.Z; Qden : BinNums.positive } Arguments QArith_base.Qmake _%Z_scope _%positive_scope

```coq
intros a b Q Hred Hcan Hcomb.
apply reducestar_eqp_com with (Q:=Q) (a:=a) (b:=b) in Hred; auto.
apply confl_mix with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) in Hred; auto.
apply confl_under with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) in Hred; auto.
apply reduceplus_mults with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) in Hred; auto.
apply reduceplus_mults_inv with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) in Hred; auto.
apply reduceplus_mults_invf0 with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) in Hred; auto.
apply fconfl_top with (A:=A) (A0:=A0) (A1:=A1) (eqA:=eqA) (plusA:=plusA) (invA:=invA) (minusA:=minusA) (multA:=multA) (divA:=divA) in Hred; auto.
Qed.```
